BrickBomb,"2015-03-21T23:01:50.31Z","Better and Bigger Than I Thought","

column1: I HATE the super jumpers. They jump just fine but getting your minifigure
column2: off the jumper is my problem. I had to&nbsp
column3: struggle to get Iron Man of the darn thing with out breaking the legs(I failed too). When stress marks appeared on the figure&nbsp
column5: tool to use as a mini crowbar. Even though the feet are now gnarled up, it&#39
column6: s a whole lot better then&nbsp
column7: broken plastic. I recommend leaving Iron Man&#39
column9: repulser cylinders on. Now on to the set.

column1: The Minifigures
First off is Iron Man Mark 45. This
column2: Iron Man&nbsp
column3: variant is exclusive to the set. It is not&nbsp
column5: as the one in the other Age of Ultron sets.&nbsp
column7: in my opinion, than the Iron Man Mark 43. Tony does not come with a hair piece but a double sided face. One face shows Tony Stark smirking and the other one angry.

column1: Next is the Ultron Sentry. This figure is in the set twice and is amazing.
column2: Except for his hands and waist, he is all dark&nbsp
column3: metallic. The detail on him is tremendous with blue energy. His face has blue&nbsp
column5: gaping mouth similar to Ultron Prime and the classic Ultron. His repulser studs are a dark transparent&nbsp
column6: blue with studs for foot repulsers instead of the usual cylinder piece. He also comes with a light grey stud shooter.

column1: Last but not least is the Ultron Sentry Officer. This minifigure is identical to the other sentries other than his helmet and backpack. His helmet is a dark metallic coloring of the one used on Ultimate Ultron in 76032. His backpack is two antennas attached to the new 2 by 1 back piece(18986).
The Model
The main build is a small ship/air craft.
column2: It has a&nbsp
column3: main section with&nbsp
column4: a long tail in the back and&nbsp
column5: two wings on the side. The two sentries are supposed to be reassembled on the craft. the head and body attach to the wings while the legs attach in the back on the sides of&nbsp
column6: the tail. While some people may not like this&nbsp
column7: I actually think this is a great function. The legs give the look of thrusters in the back while the bodies look like turrets or guns. The officer&#39
column8: s legs attach to the bottom of the front look like more thrusters or more guns. The officers body controls the craft on the top. He is completely loose and is held down by a droid arm and clip piece. The arm can be moved&nbsp
column9: down so that the officer can be shot out with the super jumper.

column1: All in all I really like this set. It is extremely fun
column2: and at a low price. I would recommend this to anyone.&nbsp

,TRUE,5,5,4,4,5 xboxtravis7992","2015-08-07T04:49:33.767Z","Ultron vs. Iron Man!","

As the smallest set in the new Avengers line, this set brings a nice pack of minifigures
column2: to the lineup, but lacks in several areas.&nbsp
column3: I bought this small set before I had the chance to see the film, so lets see how it stacks up now that I have had the chance to see the movie twice.

column1: Parts
So the parts
column2: in this set are basic gray pieces that would be familiar to any Lego Sci-Fi fan. The new blasters are a goofy yet fun play feature. The super&nbsp
column3: jumper is kind-off pointless, I haven&#39
column4: t had any leg damaging problems with it yet like other Lego fans have reported, but frankly I cannot even fit a minifigure onto it! The mold doesn&#39
column5: t allow the figure to get on without jamming it on (fair warning that it will be hard to get off the jumper), unless pieces such as Iron Man&#39
column6: s repulsors are placed first on the super jumper. The backpack used on the sentry fig has a nice transparent piece which could be used for some MOCs.

column1: Minifigures

This Iron Man figure is gorgeous. The movie provides no clear explanation as to why Stark built this armor to fight Ultron, although the smooth lines sometimes makes me wonder is Stark was copying Ultron'
column2: s&nbsp
column3: smooth armor in a sense... The Lego fig uses two tones of red to really make the fig&#39
column4: s colors pop. The three Ultron figs are nice, although I prefer the so called &quot
column6: without the super large backpack antenna things...

column1: The build
The speeder thing is a simple Lego build, no surprises, no complications... not much more to say.
The completed model

The way the Ultron figs are disassembled to ride the speeder is ridiculous. It honestly looks better without the random minifig parts everywhere. I think I might just turn it into a Star Wars speeder, or something like that...
But once the speeder is built, it is very playable. Swooshes well.
Overall opinion
I like this set for the figs and the speeder has potential with a bit of work. Although the speeder does not exist in the film, it has
column2: enough &quot
column3: plausibility&quot
column4: to look the part: unlike the drunken&nbsp
column7: flame throwing golf cart in the last cheep set Iron Man appeared in... And with some work, those pieces could become (spoiler alert) a center console for a support system capable of turning a city into a meteor, if that makes sense :)&nbsp
column8: ... Use this set for what you&nbsp
column9: want, be it parts, figs, or a swooshable&nbsp
column10: ship that defies all sense of canon. Take it for what it is, that is all I can say.

column1:
,TRUE,4,3,2,4,4 Odeinoichus","2015-10-27T14:14:10.747Z","Troop Build Ultron","

Set #76029 Iron Man vs. Ultron: Age of Ultron has been great for LEGO Marvel sets this year, we&rsquo
column2: ve seen the Hulkbuster, another Quinjet and Avengers Tower, and with this set you can have some awesome army building fun. Unfortunately it isn&rsquo
column3: t much else than a troop builder for your Ultron army, why? We&rsquo
column4: ll get into that with the review.

column1: Minifigures
Iron Man Mk 45: Unique to this set Iron Man has the details we&rsquo
column2: ve seen many times before, with double-sided torso and leg printing and the great armour piece. It&rsquo
column3: s another awesome addition to LEGO Iron Man&rsquo

column1: He comes with the new Super Jumper piece, something I haven&rsquo
column2: t discussed before, it&rsquo
column3: s a nice play feature, but a bit pointless for older collectors. And it&rsquo
column4: s hit or miss here, as you&rsquo
column5: d need to aim it very carefully to strike the top of the Sentry Officer to knock it off the ship.

column1: Ultron Sentry: Highly detailed print on this Minifigure with double-sided torso and leg printing as well as printing on the back of the head. The sentries all share this same print and I really enjoy the look of it, the attention to detail for the mechanical look of the Ultron character make these stand out quite nicely. Each regular sentry includes a stud launcher accessory.

Ultron Sentry Officer: The only difference between this figure and the regular sentries is the inclusion of a helmet piece and an interesting new 2x2 transparent backpack piece with two controlling antenna on it.
The build

The build in this set was never in the movie, not once. As far as I can tell this is a situation similar to the Star Wars Battle Packs due to licensing rights with Hasbro and their action figure department. Either way it&rsquo
column2: s a fairly weak build, it&rsquo
column3: s a funky looking flying vehicle similar to the ships used by the Chitauri in Avengers. This one cleverly incorporates the Minifigures themselves into the design as the engines for this vehicle to get it off the ground.

column1: The completed model
Fairly weak. The uniform colour scheme is the biggest saving grace. It is fun to play with, but without the Minifigures attached to it, it doesn&rsquo
column2: t fly and it doesn&rsquo
column3: t really serve much of a purpose. Honestly LEGO might have done better to make some sort of weapons platform or something else besides this odd flying chariot thing.

column1: Overall opinion

Recommended mostly for the Minifigures who are all unique to this set. If the model had been more thought out it would definitely be much higher on my list of must own sets. If you want the Mark 45 armour though this is the only means to get it. If it&rsquo
column2: s on sale though at a good discount I&rsquo
column3: d recommend picking up multiples to have multiple Ultron Sentries for your Avengers Minifigures to do battle with.

column1:
,TRUE,3,2,2,3,3 Echolord","2016-05-03T01:27:09.333Z","For something that was not in the movie, this is great!","

I was apprehensive about this set at first, but it was the cheapest way to get the Iron Man mk 45 suit, so I got it. To say the least, I was not disappointed. This set, though small, and definitely not in Age of Ultron, is amazing. It has four great minifigures, and uses some really cool concepts.
Box/Instructions
The box is the standard battle pack size, with the tab to open it on the back. I really like the box art for some reason, and I can'
column2: t place why, I just do. The instructions are short, and really simple.&nbsp

column1: Parts
This set doesn'
column2: t have any special pieces, but I do want to briefly touch on the superjumpers. And this section is entirely my opinion, so please, do not feel obligated to feel the same way about these that I do. I think the Superjumpers, though very nice in concept, are very poorly executed. They don&#39
column3: t function very well, and tend to break minifigure legs. When they do actually jump, they are completely impossible to aim, and they just make me frustrated.&nbsp

column1: Minifigures

This set is entirely a minifigure set, and there is nothing wrong with that. The Mk 45 Iron Man suit is extremely well detailed, with some new, red highlights on the dark red torso and legs. I do like the increased use of dark stone grey printing on this suit, especially on the mask, where it forms the sides of the face. The detailing on this suit is probably the best out of any Iron Man Suit yet. The Ultron soldiers and officer are really cool minifigures. They are perfect for building an Ultron army! I love the detailing on the torso and head! The legs are the same as Ultron Prime.
The build

It is a relatively short, and easy build. I spent maybe ten minutes building this, and though small, enjoyed every minute of it! The build actually incorporates the minifigures, which is a new thing that I don'
column2: t think has been done before.&nbsp

column1: The completed model

The completed Ultron hovercraft is really cool looking, especially once you attach the drones. The legs are removed, and actually built into the craft, as are the torsos and heads. The effect this gives is really neat, as it appears that the Ultron Drones are actually part of the craft.
Overall opinion
This set is awesome, and I recommend it to anyone looking to build an army of Ultron drones.

,TRUE,4,4,3,4,4 Bobbits","2017-12-22T02:57:58.47Z","Iron Man vs. Ultron Review!","

Hey everyone! Welcome to my first review! So I'

column1: So starting off, the Ultron
column2: aircraft is a nice little build. Not the greatest, but it works. It has a sleek design and the color scheme is good. It definitely captures the Ultron&nbsp

column1: Next are the minifigures. The Iron Man is pretty basic, though the mask looks good, with the bit of silver on the sides. The Ultron and Ultron
column2: bots are cool too. They have the right look, and I like the gray and blue colors. So the minifigures are nice, and you get four of them.

column1: So overall, this set is not bad for 13 bucks, since you get four minifigures. It'
column2: s definitely worth it if you want more Ultron&nbsp
column3: bots. So, good set.
